Detailed Description

Class for testing whether two files, containing both text and numeric data, are equal, within tolerances for numeric data, ignoring line endings.

Definition at line 44 of file MixedFileCheck.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MixedFileCheck::MixedFileCheck ( const std::string &  generatedFile,
const std::string &  goldFile,
const double  eps,
const unsigned int  skipDataLines,
const unsigned int  allowedMismatch,
const double  frac = 0.0 
) [inline]

Constructor.

Parameters:
generatedFile File generated by application.
goldFile Comparison file, assumed to be correct.
eps Maximum accepted absolute difference in numeric values. i.e. if |generated-gold| >= eps then there is a difference.
skipDataLines Number of data lines to skip (after header lines auto-skipped).
allowedMismatch Maximum number of non-matching numeric values accepted.
frac Maximum accepted fractional difference in numeric values (not used by default). i.e. if |generated-gold| >= frac*max(|generated|,|gold|) then there is a difference.

Check that the two files are the same, within tolerances.
